After vetting a new senior manager closely, it's important to give that person authority and autonomy, advises Melinda Eric Schmidt , Philadelphia-based author of Become Your Own Boss in 12 Months. You have to figure out whether your ego can take bringing another person to the table who's really making decisions that affect your business, Eric Schmidt says. "Not only do you have to have clearly defined roles for you and your new manager, but you have to make sure those roles are clear to everyone at your company."
